newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding via system RP, coupon pass possible.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding via system RP, coupon pass possible.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is likely to add temporary reserves to the banking system through system repurchase agreements, analysts said.

"I look for an overnight system repurchase," said Patricia Thrapp, vice president at Aubrey G. Lanston. "Today is the quarterly tax date for corporate and individual non-withheld taxes and so there's some upward pressure on the funds rate."
At midmorning, Fed funds were trading at 5-3/4 percent rate, above the Fed's 5-1/2 percent target for the rate.
Thrapp said the Fed might do an overnight operation because "there is going to be some uncertainty about fluctuations in Treasury deposits at the Fed.
"The Fed might want to play it day by day," she said.
Analysts also said the Fed could also add permanent reserves to the banking system by buying coupons.
"I think they will probably do three more rounds of coupon purchases and they could do one at any time, really," she said.
The Fed last bought coupons on Thursday, June 12.
